prompt:
Chapter 2, Verse 47:
Sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन ।
English:
completion: You have a right to perform your prescribed duty, but you are not entitled to the fruits of action.

prompt:
Chapter 4, Verse 7:
Sanskrit: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत ।
English:
completion: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and an increase in unrighteousness, O Arjuna, at that time I manifest myself on earth.

prompt:
Chapter 18, Verse 66:
Sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज ।
English:
completion: Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear.

prompt:
Chapter 3, Verse 16:
Sanskrit: एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह य: ।
English:
completion: He who does not follow the wheel of creation set in motion, sinful and sensual, he lives in vain.

prompt:
Chapter 6, Verse 5:
Sanskrit: उद्धरेदात्मनाऽत्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् ।
English:
completion: Let a man lift himself by his own self alone, and let him not lower himself.

prompt:
Chapter 12, Verse 15:
Sanskrit: यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च य: ।
English:
completion: By whom the world is not agitated and who cannot be agitated by the world, who is freed from joy, envy, fear, and anxiety—he is dear to Me.

prompt:
Chapter 10, Verse 20:
Sanskrit: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थित: ।
English:
completion: I am the Self, O Gudakesha, seated in the hearts of all creatures. I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.
